Jump Training.name: Jump Squats
Jump Training.description: Explosive squat with a jump at the top.

Jump Training.name: Broad Jumps
Jump Training.description: Jump forward as far as possible from a standing position.

Jump Training.name: Tuck Jumps
Jump Training.description: Jump high and bring knees towards the chest.

Jump Training.name: Lateral Jumps
Jump Training.description: Jump side to side over an imaginary line to improve lateral explosiveness.

Jump Training.name: Single-Leg Hops
Jump Training.description: Jump on one leg repeatedly to develop balance and lower body strength.

Jump Training.name: Split Jumps
Jump Training.description: Jump from a lunge position and switch legs mid-air.

Jump Training.name: Star Jumps
Jump Training.description: Jump while extending arms and legs out like a star.

Jump Training.name: Depth Jumps
Jump Training.description: Step off a low platform and immediately jump explosively upon landing.

Jump Training.name: Skater Jumps
Jump Training.description: Jump side to side in a speed-skater motion to build lateral power.

Jump Training.name: Kangaroo Jumps
Jump Training.description: Perform continuous forward jumps while keeping knees slightly bent.

Jump Training.name: Ankle Hops
Jump Training.description: Bounce lightly off the ground using only your ankles for quick plyometric response.

Jump Training.name: Seated Jumps
Jump Training.description: Sit down, then explosively jump up as high as possible.

Jump Training.name: Squat to Broad Jump
Jump Training.description: Perform a squat, then explode forward into a broad jump.

Jump Training.name: Pogo Jumps
Jump Training.description: Jump continuously using primarily ankle power and minimal knee bend.

Jump Training.name: Knee Drive Jumps
Jump Training.description: Jump explosively while driving one knee toward the chest.

Jump Training.name: Drop Squat Jumps
Jump Training.description: Start standing, drop into a squat, then jump explosively upward.

Jump Training.name: Rebound Jumps
Jump Training.description: Perform repeated jumps with minimal ground contact for improved reactivity.

Jump Training.name: Leg Swings
Jump Training.description: Swing one leg forward and backward to loosen hip flexors and hamstrings.

Jump Training.name: Butt Kicks
Jump Training.description: Run in place while kicking your heels toward your glutes.

Jump Training.name: High Knees
Jump Training.description: Run in place while bringing your knees up to waist level.

Jump Training.name: Lateral Leg Swings
Jump Training.description: Swing one leg side to side to loosen up the hip joints.

Jump Training.name: Arm Circles
Jump Training.description: Rotate your arms forward and backward to activate shoulders before jumping.
